intro: Sphaeranthus paniculatus, commonly known as the panicled globe flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow to orange in color, and arranged in paniculate inflorescences, giving it a delicate, clustered appearance. Sphaeranthus paniculatus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, sunny environments.
